intro: Girgensohnia bungeana, commonly known as the Bunge's girgensohnia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small, white to greenish in color. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
